depauw.edu.myro.android.sandbox

Class Movement_Accelerometer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Activity
      • depauw.edu.myro.android.sandbox.Movement_Accelerometer

  • public class Movement_Accelerometer
extends Activity
    This class enables the use of the Scribbler's movement by utilizing An Android's Accelerometer. The Accelerometer http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/sensors/sensors_overview.html
    Version:
    Summer 2014
    Author:
    Alexander Miller (DePauw University, Class of 2016), alexander.miller110@gmail.com

      • onCreate

      • onAccuracyChanged

        public void onAccuracyChanged(Sensor sensor,
                     int accuracy)

      • onSensorChanged

        public void onSensorChanged(SensorEvent event)
        onSensorChanged() checks to see if the scribbler is connected and if the Accelerometer is available. If so, then the values taken from the Accelerometer are taken and evaluated to perform Scribbler movements based on which direction the Android device is pointing towards.
        See Also:
        android.hardware.SensorEventListener#onSensorChanged(android.hardware.SensorEvent)

      • dispatchKeyEvent

        public boolean dispatchKeyEvent(KeyEvent event)
        Used to help maintain clean activity across the app. If someone is connected to the Scribbler, they should disconnect before leaving the app. This function ensures that happens.
